Feature.Description: This installs Active Directory Lightweight Directory Services (AD LDS).
Feature.Name: DirectoryServices-ADAM-Client

Feature.Description: Program your application to serve HTTP requests by using core IIS functionality.
Feature.DisplayName: Internet Information Services Hostable Web Core
Feature.Name: IIS-HostableWebCore

Feature.Description: Internet Information Services provides support for Web and FTP servers, along with support for ASP.NET web sites, dynamic content such as Classic ASP and CGI, and local and remote management.
Feature.Name: IIS-WebServerRole

Feature.Description: Enable your server to transfer files by using the FTP protocol.
Feature.Name: IIS-FTPServer

Feature.Description: Customize FTP publishing by writing your own software extensions.
Feature.Name: IIS-FTPExtensibility

Feature.Description: Enable FTP publishing on a Web server.
Feature.Name: IIS-FTPSvc

Feature.Description: Installs the IIS World Wide Web Services. Provides support for HTML web sites and optional support for ASP.NET, Classic ASP, and web server extensions.
Feature.Name: IIS-WebServer

Feature.Description: Install Web server application development features
Feature.Name: IIS-ApplicationDevelopment

Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host Classic ASP applications
Feature.Name: IIS-ASP

Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host ASP.NET 3.5 applications
Feature.Name: IIS-ASPNET

Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host ASP.NET v4.x applications
Feature.Name: IIS-ASPNET45

Feature.Description: Application Initialization perform expensive web application initialization tasks before serving web pages.

Feature.Description: Enable support for CGI executables

Feature.Name: IIS-ISAPIFilter

Feature.Name: IIS-NetFxExtensibility

Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host .NET Framework v4.x applications
Feature.Name: IIS-NetFxExtensibility45

Feature.Description: Serve .stm, .shtm, and .shtml files from a Web site
Feature.Name: IIS-ServerSideIncludes

Feature.Description: IIS and ASP.NET 4.x support writing server applications that communicate over the WebSocket Protocol.
Feature.Name: IIS-WebSockets

Feature.Description: Installs support for Web server content such as HTML and image files.
Feature.Name: IIS-CommonHttpFeatures

Feature.Description: Allows you to specify a default file to be loaded when users do not specify a file in a request URL
Feature.Name: IIS-DefaultDocument

Feature.Description: Allow clients to see the contents of a directory on your Web server
Feature.Name: IIS-DirectoryBrowsing

Feature.Description: Allows you to customize the error messages returned to clients
Feature.Name: IIS-HttpErrors

Feature.Description: Redirect client requests to a specific destination
Feature.Name: IIS-HttpRedirect

Feature.Description: Serve .htm, .html, and image files from a Web site
Feature.Name: IIS-StaticContent

Feature.Description: Publish and manage files on a Web server by using the HTTP protocol.
Feature.Name: IIS-WebDAV

Feature.Description: Enables you to monitor and manage server, site, and application health
Feature.Name: IIS-HealthAndDiagnostics

Feature.Description: Enable support for custom logging for Web servers, sites, and applications
Feature.Name: IIS-CustomLogging

Feature.Description: Enables logging of Web site activity for this server
Feature.Name: IIS-HttpLogging

Feature.Description: Enable tracing for ASP.NET applications and failed requests
Feature.Name: IIS-HttpTracing

Feature.Description: Install IIS logging tools and scripts
Feature.Name: IIS-LoggingLibraries

Feature.Description: Enable support for logging to an ODBC-compliant database.

Feature.Description: Monitor server, site, and application health
Feature.Name: IIS-RequestMonitor

Feature.Description: Install performance features
Feature.Name: IIS-Performance

Feature.Description: Compress dynamic content before returning it to client
Feature.Name: IIS-HttpCompressionDynamic

Feature.Description: Compress static content before returning it to a client
Feature.Name: IIS-HttpCompressionStatic

Feature.Description: Enable additional security features to secure servers, sites, applications, vdirs, and files
Feature.Name: IIS-Security

Feature.Description: Require a valid Windows user name and password for connection.
Feature.Name: IIS-BasicAuthentication

Feature.Description: Centralized SSL Certificate Support enables you to manage SSL server certificates centrally using a file share. Maintaining SSL server certificates on a file share simplifies management since there is one place to manage them.
Feature.Name: IIS-CertProvider

Feature.Description: Authenticate client certificates with Active Directory accounts.
Feature.Name: IIS-ClientCertificateMappingAuthentication

Feature.Description: Authenticate clients by sending a password hash to a Windows domain controller.
Feature.Name: IIS-DigestAuthentication

Feature.Description: Map client certificates 1-to-1 or many-to-1 to a Windows security identity.
Feature.Name: IIS-IISCertificateMappingAuthentication

Feature.Description: Allow or deny content access based on IP address or domain name.
Feature.Name: IIS-IPSecurity

Feature.Description: Configure rules to block selected client requests.
Feature.Name: IIS-RequestFiltering

Feature.Description: Authorize client access to the URLs that comprise a Web application.
Feature.Name: IIS-URLAuthorization

Feature.Description: Authenticate clients by using NTLM or Kerberos.

Feature.Description: Microsoft Message Queue (MSMQ) Server.
Feature.Name: MSMQ-Container

Feature.Description: The DCOM proxy feature enables MSMQ applications to use MSMQ DCOM API to connect to a remote MSMQ Server.
Feature.Name: MSMQ-DCOMProxy

Feature.Description: This feature installs the core components of MSMQ which enables you to perform basic Message queuing functions. This feature is a minimum requirement.
Feature.Name: MSMQ-Server

Feature.Description: Active Directory Domain Services Integration feature enables publishing of queue properties to Active Directory Domain Services, out-of-the-box authentication and encryption of messages using certificates registered in Active Directory Domain Services, and routing of messages across Windows sites. This feature becomes operational only when the computer joins a domain.
Feature.DisplayName: MSMQ Active Directory Domain Services Integration
Feature.Name: MSMQ-ADIntegration

Feature.Description: The HTTP Support feature allows you to expose a queue to the internet such that applications can send messages to the queue using HTTP protocol. This feature requires Internet Information Server.
Feature.Name: MSMQ-HTTP

Feature.Description: The Multicast support feature enables you to send messages to a Multicast IPAddress. Queues can be associated with a Multicast IPAddress. Messages sent to a Multicast IPAddress will be delivered to the queues that are associated with that IPAddress.
Feature.Name: MSMQ-Multicast

Feature.Description: Message Queue Triggers enables the invocation of a COM component or an executable depending on the filters that you define for the incoming messages in a given queue.
Feature.Name: MSMQ-Triggers

Feature.Description: Installs Remote Differential Compression (RDC) support for use in third-party applications.
Feature.Name: MSRDC-Infrastructure

Feature.Description: Controls media features such as Windows Media Player and Windows Media Center.
Feature.Name: MediaPlayback
WindowsMediaPlayer
Feature.Description: Play audio and video files on your local machine and on the Internet.

Feature.Description: Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) 3.5 is a set of .NET Framework classes that can be used for implementing claims-based identity in your .NET 3.5 and 4.0 applications. WIF 3.5 has been superseded by WIF classes that are provided as part of .NET 4.x. It is recommended that you use .NET 4.x for supporting claims-based identity in your applications.
Feature.Name: Windows-Identity-Foundation

Feature.Name: RemoteServerAdministrationTools-Features

Feature.Description: The BitLocker Active Directory Recovery Password Viewer helps to locate BitLocker Drive Encryption recovery passwords in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
Feature.Name: RemoteServerAdministrationTools-Features-BitLocker

Feature.Description: Failover Clustering Tools includes Failover Cluster Manager and Failover Cluster PowerShell Management.
Feature.Name: RemoteServerAdministrationTools-Features-Clustering

Feature.Description: Group Policy Management Tools includes Group Policy Management Console, Group Policy Management Editor, and Group Policy Starter GPO Editor.

Feature.Description: Remote Access Management Tools include graphical and PowerShell tools for managing Remote Access
Feature.Name: RemoteServerAdministrationTools-Roles-RemoteAccess

Feature.Description: Volume Activation Tools can be used to manage volume activation license keys on a Key Management Service (KMS) host or in Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services. You can use the Volume Activation Tools to install, activate, and manage one or more volume activation license keys, and to configure KMS settings.
Feature.Name: RemoteServerAdministrationTools-Roles-VA

Feature.Description: Windows Server Update Services allows network administrators to specify the Microsoft updates that should be installed, create separate groups of computers for different sets of updates, and get reports on the compliance levels of the computers and the updates that must be installed.
Feature.Name: RemoteServerAdministrationTools-Roles-WSUS
